src:
国能齐力拖累 马股跌0.19%
05 Nov 2019, 05:14 by Surin Murugiah
（吉隆坡5日讯）国家能源（Tenaga Nasional Bhd）、齐力工业（Press Metal Aluminium Holdings Bhd）及大马机场控股（Malaysia Airports Holdings Bhd）等股拖累，马股早盘下跌0.19%。
休市时，富时隆综指报1600.44点，跌3.12点。
下跌股318只、上升股236只，520只无起落。成交量有14亿6000万股，值9亿2100万令吉。
主要下跌股包括Nestle (M) Bhd、British American Tobacco (M) Bhd、Press Metal、Apollo Food Holdings Bhd、MAHB、Tenaga、MISC Bhd、Latitude Tree Holdings Bhd和Cycle & Carriage Bintang Bhd。
热门股有IFCA MSC Bhd、Eduspec Holdings Bhd、Sapura Energy Bhd、Velesto Energy Bhd及Mudajaya Group Bhd。
上升股则有Kuala Lumpur Kepong Bhd、Hong Leong Industries Bhd、Southern Acids (M) Bhd、Serba Dinamik Holdings Bhd、IJM Plantations Bhd、Mega First Corp Bhd、Aeon Credit Service (M) Bhd和Mesiniaga Bhd。
路透社报道，亚洲股市周二接近7月高位，因有迹象表明，美国与中国之间的贸易战正接近休兵，而且市场乐观认为，美国经济将实现由消费推动的稳健增长。
MSCI明晟亚太地区（除日本）指数微升0.1%，上日触及4个月高点。
艾芬黄氏资本研究指出，过去两个月一直低于1600点的综指，昨日反弹收高，升破该关口。
“目前的技术反弹仍在进行中，这可从日线图的一些指标看出，看涨势头依然强劲。”
该研究机构预计，综指近期将重新上探1615点水平，并称正在呈技术压抑后反弹。
（编译：陈慧珊）

English version：
KLCI sheds 0.19% as Tenaga, Press Metal and MAHB weigh

Via theedgemarkets.com
text:
Guoneng Qi Li dragged down the Malaysian stocks down 0.19%
05 Nov 2019, 05:14 by Surin Murugiah
KUALA LUMPUR (Reuters) - The Malaysian stock market fell 0.19% in early trading, dragged down by shares of Tenaga Nasional Bhd, Press Metal Aluminium Holdings Bhd and Malaysia Airports Holdings Bhd.
At the close of the market, the FBM KLCI reported 1600.44 points, down 3.12 points.
There were 318 stocks and 236 stocks, and 520 had no ups and downs. The trading volume was 1.46 billion shares, valued at RM921 million.
Major downtrends include Nestle (M) Bhd, British American Tobacco (M) Bhd, Press Metal, Apollo Food Holdings Bhd, MAHB, Tenaga, MISC Bhd, Latitude Tree Holdings Bhd and Cycle & Carriage Bintang Bhd.
Popular stocks include IFCA MSC Bhd, Eduspec Holdings Bhd, Sapura Energy Bhd, Velesto Energy Bhd and Mudajaya Group Bhd.
The rising stocks include Kuala Lumpur Kepong Bhd, Hong Leong Industries Bhd, Southern Acids (M) Bhd, Serba Dinamik Holdings Bhd, IJM Plantations Bhd, Mega First Corp Bhd, Aeon Credit Service (M) Bhd and Mesiniaga Bhd.
Reuters reported that Asian stock markets were close to the July high on Tuesday, as there are signs that the trade war between the United States and China is approaching the truce, and the market is optimistic that the US economy will achieve steady growth driven by consumption.
MSCI's Asia Pacific (excluding Japan) index edged up 0.1%, hitting a four-month high on the previous day.
Affin Huang’s Capital Research pointed out that the KLCI, which has been below 1600 points in the past two months, rebounded yesterday and rose above the threshold.
"The current technical rebound is still in progress. This can be seen from some indicators on the daily chart, and the bullish momentum is still strong."
The research institute expects that the KLCI will re-explore the 1615 level in the near future and said it is rebounding after technical suppression.
(Compile: Chen Huishan)

English version:
KLCI sheds 0.19% as Tenaga, Press Metal and MAHB weigh

Via theedgemarkets.com
